title: Dumbbell Curl Negatives
description: Dumbbell curl negatives focus on the eccentric (lowering) phase of the movement to increase muscle strength and hypertrophy. Instead of lifting the dumbbell explosively, you slowly lower it over 3-5 seconds, maximizing muscle tension and control. This method helps improve biceps endurance, size, and overall strength.

articles.title: DO's
list: ✔ Use a Controlled Descent – Lower the dumbbell slowly (3-5 seconds) to maximize muscle tension.
✔ Engage Your Core – Keep your core tight to prevent unnecessary swaying.
✔ Maintain Proper Posture – Stand upright with shoulders back and chest up.
✔ Use a Challenging but Manageable Weight – Choose a weight that allows slow control without failure.
✔ Keep Your Elbows Stationary – Ensure your elbows stay close to your torso.
✔ Breathe Properly – Inhale as you lower the dumbbell and exhale before resetting.

articles.title: DONT's
list: ❌ Don’t Rush the Negative Phase – The eccentric portion should be slow and controlled, not rushed.
❌ Don’t Swing the Weight – Avoid using momentum to cheat the movement.
❌ Don’t Overextend Your Elbows – Keep a slight bend at the bottom to avoid joint stress.
❌ Don’t Arch Your Back – If you have to lean back, the weight is too heavy.
❌ Don’t Let the Weight Drop – Lower it with control to engage muscles fully.
